text: Franklin Patrick Herbert Jr. (October 8, 1920 â€“ February 11, 1986) was an American science-fiction author best known for the 1965 novel Dune and its five sequels. Herbert died of a pulmonary embolism while recovering from pancreatic cancer surgery on February 11, 1986. ==References== ==Other websites== * Official website for Brian Herbert and Kevin Anderson * Frank Herbert SF Hall of Fame induction (Kevin Anderson report with his speech) Category:1920 births Category:1986 deaths Category:Deaths from pulmonary embolism Category:Deaths from surgical complications Category:Deaths from pancreatic cancer Category:American novelists Category:American science fiction writers Category:Writers from Tacoma, Washington Category:Writers from Oregon Category:People from Salem, Oregon
title: Frank Herbert
